title: 70s typeface needs identifying
content:
Could anyone please identify this font. It is the sort of typeface that was hand-drawn for logos and labels back in the old days of rotring and tee-square - and sure enough, I have to reproduce an old label at least 30 years old using this typeface.  
I attach a jpg of the word in the hope that someone will recognise it.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Pure Label.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020025541/http:/typophile.com/files/Pure%20Label.jpg) | 106.44 KB |
author: goanna2

comments.content:
[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/geometric-885/geometric-885/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020025541/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/geometric-885/geometric-885/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/geometric-885/geometric-885/")

which some of us remember as Bloc - from VGC Typositor days  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/vgc/bloc/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020025541/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/vgc/bloc/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/vgc/bloc/")

{Please note -there is a section here for ID'ing fonts - and not in Design. I'm sure someone will move this soon.)
